page.title: 01Rural NW Norfolk
page.content: An area of undulating sandy soil, predominatly of agricultural use, though with scattered areas of mostly deciduous woodland. Necton Common is one, where we found a few cattle grazing. Some few dozen sheep & pigs; & also a riding stables. Bradenham and Holme Hale have both ancient churches & houses indicating lengthy settlement and modern developments, cheaper housing has attracted many retired people, Holme Hale having but 12 working out of 400 population. Some villagers work on farms or allied trades like machine maintenance & lorry driving; others travel up to 25 miles to work in local towns. Bradenham boasts a Primary School - Holme Hale's closed July 1985. Older children travel to Swaffam and King's Lynn. There are bus services to local towns usually
